alert.note: Alert for Albany (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 13 at 2:50PM MDT until August 13 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Albany County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 600 PM MDT. * At 250 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in portions of the Mullen burn scar. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Albany, Woods Landing-Jelm, Woods Landing, Lake Owen Campground, Lake Owen, Evans Creek Campground, Miller Lake Campground and Boswell Creek Campground, Highway 230. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is possible. The heavy rains will may trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
